name: Arabella Fields
description: '''Arabella Fields''' (née Sarah Arabella Middleton, also known as "Belle Fields, the Black Nightingale"; January 31, 1879 – after 1933) was an African-American singer. She moved to Europe in 1894 and is thought to be among the first black-American artists to record in Europe, making recordings of songs by [[Stephen Foster]]. She spoke five languages and was successful with European audiences singing [[lieder]] and [[yodeling]].
